reg_info.citation: R.R.O. 1990, Reg. 570: SCHOOL HEALTH PROGRAMS AND SERVICES

content.section: Prescribed school health programs and services
content.content:
1. (1) Pursuant to subsections 6 (1) and (3) of the Act, every board of health shall provide the health programs and services set out in Column 1 of the Table to this section for the classifications of pupils set out opposite the program or service in Column 2 of the Table. O. Reg. 413/15, s. 2. (2) In the Table, “assessment” means the systematic collection and analysis of information in respect of an individual in order to provide a basis for making decisions about that individual’s health care; (“évaluation”) “surveillance” means the systematic and ongoing collection, collation and analysis of information in respect of a population of individuals in order for a board of health to plan, monitor, report on and evaluate programs. (“surveillance”) O. Reg. 413/15, s. 2. TABLE  Item   Column 1   Health Programs and Services   Column 2   Classifications of Pupils 

  1.   Oral health assessment, including screening   Elementary school pupils 

  2.   Oral health surveillance, including screening   Elementary school pupils 

  3.   Oral health promotion   Elementary school pupils 

  4.   Immunization for designated diseases as defined in the Immunization of School Pupils Act   All pupils 

  5.   Recording and assessment of immunization status   All pupils 

  6.   Vision screening   Elementary school pupils O. Reg. 413/15, s. 2; O. Reg. 137/18, s. 1.
